text: 750ml bottle from OHares. Vintage 2016. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sour, slightly funky, just some herbs and flowers, and, of course, barrel notes. Taste is pretty the same. Refreshing and pleasant, somewhat similar to Flora BA, which I liked a little bit more, though.

Backlog beer rating, Nov 26, 2016.
750ml bottle @ random parking lot in Everett(didnt want to go over my limit, so had to take down a manageable big bottle). Pours a hazy yellow golden colour
with a sizeable white head. Nose is very herbal, sweet, hints of spices and oak. Flavour is great, not that acidic, fruity and different is so many ways. Balanced of fruit, tartness, and herbs.
Smell is herbs and christmas candy. Taste is mild sour and brett and minty candy. Medium body, low carbonation, and no foam.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Im not sure of the vintage, but it is probably 2012 or 2013. 
Aroma is very herbal and floral with yarrow and lavender. Light phenolic notes and citrus with a lemongrass character. Some coriander and grains of paradise. 
Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with a small, thick white head that quickly recedes to the edges and disappears. 
Flavor is slightly acidic with a medium light citrus notes. Moderate herbal and floral notes. Some yarrow and lavender notes. Quite a bit of coriander and birds of paradise. Light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a great beer. Tons of floral and herbal notes with a bit of citrus. I really like this beer; Upright is criminally underrated. Herbal, floral and citrus notes are very gin like. Age hasnt really hurt this beer, though the flavor is a bit more muted.

Bottle shared at THT. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of fruity peppers, lemongrass, spicy notes and herbs (special ones). Flavour is above light sweet and light to moderate sour. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation. [26-08-2016]

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 11/25/2013.

Clear yellow with a small white head. A little leggy and a thin collar.

Wow its bizarre but incredible. Spices. Bright acidity. Some maltiness. Weird herbal and spicy character. 

Follows the smell. Herbal. Sharp tang. Slightly sweet pale malt. Oak. Im not a gin drinker, so I dont know whats coming from the base beer and from the barrel.

Medium body. Slightly sweet. Low sourness.

I dont know what to say about this except that its awesome and I dont know why.
Pours cloudy yellow color with no head huge juniper and peppercorn nose. Light sourness light mouthfeel. Ling sour finish very good.

Sampled at THT August. Bottle thanks to RandomStrangerNL. Hazy golden, white head. Sweet malts, special herb, juniper, orange peel, deep fruity lemony, white pepper, herbal, quite soapy, allesreiniger. Medium sweet, light sour/zesty. Medium body, light minerallike texture.

75cl bottle shared at August THT.
No head. Very hazy golden pour. Herbal and peach aftertaste

Bottle shared at THT. Hazy golden with short lasting white head. Ginger, Szechuan peppers, lemon, grassy, spicy yeast, light malts, lactic notes, flowery. Quite herbal indeed with tart lemon, light mineral and theres some of the saison underneath. Dont get much spirits. Almost medium sour and light sweet. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation.
Bottle shared at August THT. Hazy raw yellow with no head. Notes of vinegar, spices, lemongrass, ginger, peppers. Medium body, light carbonation and a tart finish.

Bottle at THT tasting. Hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of herbs, anise, juniper, homeopathic medicine and a bit of forest. Flavor is quite herbal, slightly minty and very smooth. Nice balance.

Bottle from Imperial Tap Room bottle shop. Pours cloudy blonde with a bubbly white head and a sourish fruit aroma. There is a slightly sweet, then sour pale malt flavor with a wine finish. Lots of oak and a hint of gin.

Thank you Mathieu87 & PriorL! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Epic beer Tasting 2016. Hazy golden, little white head. Nose is big ginger, lime, mellow, spice tea, intense ginger & other spices. Taste is big juicy lemon & big ginger, lime zest, juicy, low sourness. Big refreshing mildly sour cocktail tropical ginger brew. Very juicy, not for everyone but I quite liked. Surprised about learning that this is a peach beer. Gin & botanicals make definitely sense in hindsight. Que: Qx2zU1c2LFM (youtube)

Small whitish head, lightly veiled golden beer. Ginger, lavender, limepeel. Sourish, lemon, red/whitecurrant and lots of ginger, some other spices. Light to medium bodied, very low carbonation. too spicy - still, some like this.
750ml bottle pours out a hazy gold topped with a white head. nose is citrus funky notes pine cheese white grapes and oak. Taste is more of the citrus notes lemongrass pine floral spices and the oak.

Bottle to taster...thanks kbudd
Consummation: sour farmhouse ale
Adjunct: ginger beer aroma, cloudy yellow, very smooth and balanced

Bottle in the dining room, shared by myself, you turkeys! 
Pours a nice golden color with a rise and fall head akin to macro lager, the beer features some prominent tiny bubbles, which is fine.

Goodness, Ive never smelled anything like this before, funk, lemon, peach, a bunch of pine, some very mild chalkboard eraser, berries, wow. Bright & complex for sure. 

The flavor is really interesting too, its just loaded with peach & white grape fruitiness. It starts with just a touch of sweetness but finishes very dry, its got some lemon, orange peel, some juniper, & some wood... its fairly sour and the acidity certainly lingers on the finish. Im astounded at how much of the Gin character comes through here though, Ive never had a Gin-Barrel-Aged anything that retained as much of the character of the spirit as this does. 

This bottle is nearly 2 years old by now, and maybe there was a higher herbal character when it was young, maybe it was more like a Gruit... but dam son if this isnt just fine right now.

Pours a hazy dark golden yellow color with a half finger white head that quickly settles into a thin ring. Spotty lacing left behind. 

Musty, earthy aroma with funky bugs and dry, earthy oak along with autumnal spice. juniper and gin barrel character faintly coming in. Brett and oak presence is strong with a decent amount of earthiness and musty funk. The gin barrel really stands out but Im not getting much peach or red wine character. 

On the lighter end of medium body with dry puckering funk and a very prominent brett presence countered by spicy ginger, sweet juniper and earthy barrel notes. Lots of dry oak and damp, earthy funk dominating the flavor. Again, Im picking up spices and wild yeast but not much peach or wine character. Very dry but has decent flavor especially from the wild yeast, light fruit and gin.

Bottle at home. Hazy glowing orange pour with a small heas and OK lacing. Big herbal aroma - juniper, lavender, hibiscus, some band-aid, super citrusy, fresh orange peels, and botanicals. Taste is big citrus tones, oranges, lemons, grapefruits, herbs, basil, lots of lavender, cardamom, and and lemongrass with a medium sour finish. Medium body with low carbonation. Really interesting beer.

750, capped. Pours a murky medium amber with no head to speak of after a few seconds. Vinous nose, with stone fruit, juniper, and pink peppercorns showing. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Stone fruit leads on the mid palate with lots of lemony wine, juniper, and pink peppercorns. Oak is soft but just barely there. Long dry finish. Lovely.

This poured a murky yellow with a white head. Aroma was of botanicals, lime, lemon juice, light grassy wet hay and pitted fruit. Flavor similar, gin upfront, funky wine barrel and spent peach flesh in the finish. Awesome stuff.

Bottle from Mike, thanks buddy! Appearance is golden with lively white head. Aroma is citrus, funky cheese, white grapes and oak. Taste is very tart, with hints of wine, citrus, lime, and cheese funk. Lots of carb, nice body. This is tart and very refreshing, lots of citrus flavour, with a nice dry finish, really great stuff, well done!

Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Pours a bright orangey yellow with a white head. Aromas of gin botanicals, lemon, lime, light ginger, pine. Light peach/citrus. Awesome aroma. Taste is mild sourness. Just the perfect amount for me. This is so enjoyable and refreshing and unique.
Bottle thanks to Johns grocery. A ton of fruit in the nose. Light wood and fruitiness in the flavor as well. Really yummy.

Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip. I think this is a couple months old or so.

Appearance: Pours a translucent gold/amber with a very mild red hue to it. A finger of white head fades very quickly to nothing but a ring around the rim of the glass.

Smell: Wow. Big juniper berry, mild brett, cranberry, green apple, peach, ginger, white grapes. Lots of amazing floral notes - hard to describe them all. Fantastic. Who needs to drink this? I smelled it for a good 15 minutes before taking a sip.

Taste: Awesome. The aromas come through terrifically in the taste. Lots of sour berries and fruits: juniper, cranberry, grapes, lime, peach, ginger, green apple. A nice, mild amount of sour and brett. Quite dry finish. Very complex and delicious. Alcohol is all masked.

Mouth-feel: Low to medium carbonation (but definitely enough) with a light, dry body. Very crisp and dry.

Overall: I had high expectations for this as a big lover of gin and they were exceeded. I wish I could get this more often. I love the berry flavor additions to the more standard light gueuze-like qualities. The gin and wine barrels have made this beer absolutely outstanding. Very complex, very well balanced, and outlandishly refreshing and delicious.

Bottle: Thanks, Matt. Cloudy orange & golden body with a fluffy, bright white head perched on top. Lovely aroma includes herbal notes, hay, straw, yeasty pepper esters, lactic tartness, lemon zest, lavender, coriander, maybe a touch of cobweb & oak. Light, very saison-like. Flavor is more woody with strong notes of flowers, grass, yogurt, sour lacto yeast, funky strawberry, herbal white pepper, lemon zest, a bit of green apple, some wet hay in the finish. More herbal & spicy in the front-end while it finishes more tart, lemony, & slightly lactic. Nice array of flavors. Absolutely delicious.
Bottle - Lots of herbs and grass and sweet basil. Hazy gold with a decent white head. Very herbal, tart with some sweetness and a long light sweet herbal finish.

Bottle shared by Al, pours hazy and well carbonated golden color with white head. Notes of wet wood, grass, tangy florals, lime zest, salty mineral, dry gin, lemongrass and Brett funk. Reminds me a little but of herbes houblon but earthier than that with the gruit type cedar also hitting the taste buds. Dry and tart wood funk in the finish with oceanic qualities. Lighter to medium bodied. Tasty

Sampled thanks to hannont at a bottle share - Pours clear yellow / gold with a light white head. The aroma has lemon sourness, some leafy herbs, pale malt and a sharp crispness. It has a medium / light bright and crisp body with mild carbonation. The flavor starts with sharp herbs, lemon, orange, pale malt and is on the bright citric side. The finish has more of the herbs and sourness showing through. Quite excellent.
Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured a hazy golden color with a white head. The aroma was of straw, spices and citrus. The taste was of straw, citrus, spice with a crisp dry tart finish. Nice.
Bottle. Orange pour with white head. Spice, herb and funky fruit aromas. Pear, fruit, herbal toned flavors. Funky and tart, but smooth.

Pour is golden amber, light haze, with a tight off white head. Nose is sweet, white grapes and golden fruits combine with a boozy note and a moderate spice to it. Taste is much brighter and more integrated. Strong peach notes come through, the booze is integrated rather than another contrasting flavor. Strong herbal flowery spice throughout the finish. Light body, enough carbonation, and a fairly dry finish.

Bottle, latest batch. Pours a lightly cloudy pale peach with one finger of head that quickly fades into a ring of lacing. Aroma is super nice: Chardonnay, peach, yellow plum, faint strawberry, and bold funky Basque cider mingle with grassy herbs and floral gin botanicals, as well as ripe and juicy lambic fruit, a la Vigneronne. Taste is a really intriguing mixture of unripe peach, sour plum, dried apple, and an earthy mixture of grains and acidity like a dry-hopped lambic. Carbonation is on the low side. Long finish with great balance. Damn, Ive become such an Upright fanboy.
Bottle share. 2013. Cloudy light orange. Aroma of sour citrus, straw, funky yeast. Taste is tart, and a touch citrus sweet. Very good. Not a long lingering dryness.

Wow. Bottle from Prufrockstar - thanks Chris! This is another beer I feel guilty not sharing, it is both unusual and fantastic. Slightly hazy amber pour with nice white lacing and a white head. Nose is awesome - oak, flowers, botanicals, a tiny bit of lime. Taste is equally interesting, ever so slightly tart, citrus, a hint of gin and oak. Really awesome. Dr. Doom to boot. Winning.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2014 Bottle courtesy of Prufrock.

Light tan pour. White head. Lovely aroma. Gin forward, herbs, spearmint. Lemon. Tart clean flavor. White grape and pine. Gin again. I love this. Reminds me of something that ale apothecary would do. Once beastie tells me theyre there, I can taste the peach skins. Delightful.

750 ml bottle. Clear, nearly orange pour with offwhite head. Aroma is fantastic. Specially herbal indeed - gin, medicinal, throat lozenge, pear/tropical fruit juice. Reminds me a lot of ale apothecary stuff. Taste is nice as well. Tart, herbal, light cereal in the finish (along with a hint of pickle juice?). Slick texture, medium body, short crisp finish. Overall: this is great. Flavorful, complex, unique, easy to drink but also invites savoring. Want moar.

Bottle thanks to Nick. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with small off white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is lemon, oak, funk, gin. Thin mouthfeel with tart lemon, light funk, gin with light dry finish. Very nice.

Damn, this beer kicked ass. Pours a hazy dull pale golden color with a finger of white fizzy foam. Tons of juniper, spruce, wet wood, ginger ale, rosemary, pinot noir, some round stonefruit hints in the background. Absolutely delicious !

750ml bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours hazy orange with medium head. Nose is juicy tart fruit, woody spice, ginger, spruce, evergreen, funk. Taste is juicy tart stonefruit, dry wood, spicy ginger, fruity herbal spirits, dusty funk, mint leaf. Finish is dry tart rustic grains with juicy herbal stonefruit funk and mingling gin and herbal spice. Great!
Apricot small white head. Quite tart and lemony. Big and citric in the middle. Great beer.

750 ml bottle shared with the Quebec City crew. Pours a murky orangeish golden with a short lived white head. Aroma is dry, hay, dust. Flavor is lemon, vanilla, cake. Finish is soft, yeast, bread and vanilla. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation.

Bottle... Hazy golden pour with a small, creamy, white head that dissipates faster than you can say quick. The aroma is restrained, but offers a nice marriage of oak and light funk  not real herbal. Medium-bodied with Key West carbonation. The flavor is medium-sour and bready. Not all that herbal here either. Finishes tart, yeasty, and then bone-dry. Many thanks to landhoney for sharing this one with the entire South Florida Brew Crew!

Super botanical nose. Tons of gin herbal notes juniper? Peach, funky yeast notes a little tart a little winey. Pours hazy golden orange white ring of foam. Tart peachy gin wine barrel there's a lot going on here. Lingering tang and fruit. Nice carbonation. A little funky lingering yeast. Cool beer.
Crazy tasting beer, thanks GT2, gold pour, white head, smelled of tart lemon, taste was very acidic, apple, herbs, interesting.

Bottle @ GTs Cat Cabana. Thanks, GT. Clear golden pour with a tall white head. Aromas of tart lemon, rosemary, juniper, chamomile, and lavender. A bit of dusty old books, apple juice, and wood. Interesting. This tastes like what Id imagine old books that are never checked out of a library taste like. Also, cork, lemon, rosemary, lavender, and juniper. Slight apple juice sweetness, apricot, and citric acidity. Crazy.

750 ml bottle to taster (shared by dudeabide). Looks good; a hazy golden orange with eggshell head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; some mild acidity, oak, and funk. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. A bit of gin twang too. And some light peach as it opens up. Nice stuff!
750ml bottle as pictured. REally nice brew, good gin and piney flavors, sweet up fornt with a dry finish.

shimmering gold, small white head to ring. Juniper heavy nose is ultra bright, tons of bright citrus, unimaginable delicacy in soft gravel, dusty and delightful. Flavor stings with acid first, bright lactic notes before dusty and gravel mid, juniper and lemon citrus complimenting each other through the soft finish that lasts forever until a final hiss on the palate, like the radio.
Bottle pours a cloudy straw/orange with a small fizzy head and no real lacing. Aroma of citrus, spruce, herbs, and floral hints. Flavor is tart and tangy. Yum.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, small off white head, decent lacing. Aroma is Brett, lemon, funk, oak. Gueuze like. Flavor is light sweet, a bit of juniper and gin, oaky, funky, a bit of astringence. Some funk, Bretty. Medium body, low carbonation. Yum.

Bottle. Thanks to Brian. 

A: Cloudy lemon, white head and good lacing. 

N: Eucalyptus, gin, pine, spruce, and lemons. Tangerine and juniper. Coniferous.

T: Sour and slightly sweet. Gin is pronounced. 

M: Carbonated with a light body. 

O: A crazy, interesting gruit thats got a big reputation and earns it. Try it.

20th February 2014Fare thee well Josh tasting at Bruces. Thanks Bruce! Hay gold beer, bubbly pale cream coloured head. Palate is lght and dry and a little crisp. Winey tangy, mildly sour peach, not getting much Gin though. Little floralness. This could have been a belter if not so much wine barrel swamping the gin. Very nice though.

Bottle... Poured hazy golden/yellow with a thin forming head. Aroma of gin, botanicals, and earthy/perfumy flowers. Nice acidity and tartness here with a little bit of drying yeast tones, and tangy vinegar. Good herbal earthy and spicy character with a nice tart finish. Really nice, a classic from Upright.

Bottle shared in London for my farewell drinks.Big thanks to Bruce. Pours hazy golden with a thick white cap leaving some nice lacing. Nose is full of straw, hay, typical barnyard notes, quite citric with lemon focus, with great additions of mango and passionfruit. Think a tropical and citric earthy mix. Taste is very tangy and tropical with plenty of mango, passionfruit, peach, tangerine and apricot. Zesty stuff! A superb tangy citric rind finish with a slight herbal note throughout. Absolute treat to drink this

Bottle shared at Joshs Farewell Hoorah - big thanks to Bruce, 20/02/14. Cool label !
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white swirl.
Nose is light spice, hint floral, ginger, herbal qualities, bitter orange, oregano, white pepper.
Taste comprises tarte peach, light brett, orange pith, tangy citrics, straw, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Solid stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London to celebrate Joshs departure. Pours lightly hazy gold with a frothy white head. Lovely aroma, plenty of ripe citrus fruits, tangerine, herbs. Light-medium sweet flavor with tangy citrus fruits, mellow woody dryness, faint bitter herbs, mild vinegar and citric tang. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet and lightly tangy on the finish, some citric tartness, mild acetic bite. Very tasty and refreshing.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours clear golden with a small white head. The nose is funky, slightly sweet, gin, white grape, herb, spice and hay. The taste is crisp, tart, earthy, vinous, wood, gin, lactic, sour yellow plum, white grape, minerals, herb and sherbet with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Interesting, flavoursome and balanced. Pretty awesome.
Bottle..pour is golden with a thin head that fades..Nose is nice oak, spice, funk, stone fruit..Taste is tropical fruits, oak, spice, funk, dry oak, apple, some gin, lemon aid .dry

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks dude. pours clear pale golden with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. dusty bretts, powdery candies, lightly tart lemons, sweet tarts, lightly woodsy, vinous - white wine, fruitiness plenty - apricots and other small yellow fruits, gin qualities - fairly herbal, miscellaneous that is, but also mint, seven-up *tm, fresh oranges, lean yet juicy maltiness, chalk. lively carbonation, light body - oily, almost syrupy (!), light acidity - gently lactic and citric mostly, lightly tart herbal-citrusy finish. excellent!

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Thomas and Chris who both sent me one! Clear golden with a small white head and light lacing. Aroma is really interesting with light sourness, honey, gin, minty touch, spices and fruity notes. Taste is slightly sour with honey, gin, herbal notes, spices, mint and vinous notes. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Sour finish with a touch of alcohol. Quite complex and really unique. Nice balance between all those components. Very good!

Bottle shared by tom10101, thanks a lot Tommy! Pours a clear golden with no head and no lacing (a recurring theme today). Nose is really fresh with menthol and various spices. Taste is fruity, fresh and gently tart. Really atypical and fun. Mouthfeel is juicy, the drink itself plenty refreshing. Thanks again Tom for the opportunity!
The acidity reminds me of kombucha with hints of white wine through out. Candy and herbal notes play with apricot peach pineapple notes. A really special bottle to share with friends.

Aroma: Grassy, Watermelon, Dandelions, Mild Apricots

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Hay, Grassy, Mild Apricots

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Funky
Orange hazy beer with a big white head. Aroma is apricot, some herbal aroma and some juniper maybe? Taste is slightly tart lemon, apricot, peaches and oak. Swell.

Bottle shared at Jackie Os by ogglethorpe or Puddintane (2011 from notes). Pours a bright golden color with a thin white fine bubbled head. The aroma is citrusy, herbal, gin notes, herbal and grassy. The flavor is herbal, some citrus, some freshly cut grass, lemon, and juniper. Light bodied with a refreshing spritzy carbonation. The finish is lightly tart and slightly acidic. Solid beer and worth seeking out.

Bottle with a really cool label. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Mild citrus aromas. Light citrus and mild stone fruit highlights. Not overly sour or tart. Somewhat acidic. Decent body and mouthfeel.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene, via Matt. Pours a burnished gold, little to no head. Nose honey, Brett, funk, bigger as it warms. Body lively, tart, funky. Lingering wood, vinous. Not as in love as some are, but another good beer from Upright.

A - pours glowing golden straw with low white frothy head. S - Aromas are refreshingly tart citrus juice and peel (lime, lemon and light cuties), very light funk with some must. Gin and tonic notes seem to shine through, light herbal notes. M- nice tart beer. Not expected at all. Light medium body with a bit of heft in the end. Rich palate with a sweet tart ending. T - taste is bright tart citrus, especially lime. Some funkiness and a rolling sense if gin and tonic. Almost gueze like in its quality. Though thicker round the middle and with more outright complexity that a nice subtle gueze. O - a really great sour. Unexpected and just fun. 4.1
Yellow with a pale head. Aroma is apricot, cheese, guava, honey. Medium bodied, tart on the palate, sweet and sour finish. Taste is guava, apricot, dried peach, herbs. Very interesting.

Wanna make a Gruit good? Do this to it. Blend a horrible style with yeast innoculated wine barrel aged peaches.... WINNER. The base beer is in there and is odd and a tiny bit herbal and Ginny but the peaches and lactic tartness are really nice.

75cl bottle shared at City Beer courtesy of deekyn - cheers Dustin my friend! Light gold pour with a bit of white froth. Aroma gives lots of interesting mandarin orange, light lemon juice, slightly sweet musty funk, serious gin and tonic notes (honestly), light herbal notes. Taste gives plenty of lovely light and zesty citrus, some light and musty funkiness, more G&T character, hints of lime and grapefruit. Lingering spritzy citrus and mellow gin notes, some lingering tart funkiness in there too, nothing major but enough to tickle the palate. Great little creation, this beer just screams 'summer' at me. Delighted to have tried it - cheers again Dustin.

Bottle shared at Collected Works tasting. Rosemary and lemony piney notes on the aroma, with the gin aspirating it into an almost pine sol character. Cedar, juniper and lemon verbena flavor notes, really smooth and round. Nice firm tartness. Considering how "kitchen sink" this beer is, it really ended up clean and sensible.
Wow this is awesome, sweet and tart with some barrel flavors, sweet to flavors and the peaches really show, amazing stuff

750mL bottle, purchased at BeerCraft. Pours like hazy peach juice; off-white head quickly vanishes. Beautiful herbal aroma with a lemony, funky core; an herbaceous midpoint between gin-and-juice and a mimosa; peachy funk and firmly tart expression; some really deft, unique stuff. Pulpy, moderate-fizzy carbonation, and a whole lot of lemon zest and gin-like herbal qualities; plus, theres sort of a juicy, pink-grapefruit wedge feel to it; even a light salinity; Im not sure Ive ever had a beer quite like this before, but I hope to again.

Wow! Aroma is awesome! Gin barrels definitely come through with beautiful citrus, floral, botanical, apple and spice overtones. Mouthfeel is perfect! Medium bodied, with prickly carbonation and mouthwatering, tart, dry finish. Someone mentioned a apple&cinnamon dessert and i get it!? Botanical/floral/citrus/apple/spice layers follow thru the finish. Savory saline qualities remind me of sea salt and caramel. Great balance! Soooooo good! So many layers. Even reminiscent of 'Sprite' soda mixed with Gin. A ton of flavor for 5.4%! 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

750mL bottle, pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of gin, various weird spices, a little bit of peaches, and oak. Flavour brings out loads of oak, white wine notes, a little cider, subtle peach, and some unidentifiable herbs in there. Quite acidic, oaky and vinous (from the gin). Couldnt drink a lot of this due to the acidity, but for a gruit ale, I dont see how this could be much better. Solid stuff.

750mL thanks to GT2 via brainlair. Pour is a hazy golden to light amber. Small foam, barely laces. Aroma is baked apples, not acetaldehyde, more of a sweet cinnamon apple dessert, pie crust, honeysuckle, some buttery dough. Taste is honey, a touch sour, juicy with Brett C pineapple, peaches. Touch of sourness but not acetic or overpowering. Complex, but easy to drink. Meshes well together. Wooooo

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 750mL b2 (new Dr Doom label) thanks to brainlair. Major want for a long time! Pours full haze deep peach, a touch darker than expected but still orange in color. Medium white foam (poured very cold so head formation may have been minimized). Nose is quite juicy from the start- peach, sugar, tart ruby red grapefruit, something sweeter like a kriek with juicy black cherry. Taste is effervescent, dry, fairly tart with lime and peach at the front and more of a Hill Farmstead style sweet butter in the finish. Just a bit too buttery right now so will let this one warm up a bit and revisit.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~After warming up, there is still juicy peach and a lot more vibrant white wine barrel plus its latent funk, a bit footy if you will with the lacto. Then finally, there is that flash of the entire purpose of this beer, the Ransom Old Tom Gin barrel that comes through. Yellow rose is one of those components that is unique to Upright. More fresh botanicals pile on. Once it is room temperature, the sweet cream butter and fresh southern biscuit blend with the fresh Brett C pineapple, nectarines, and yellow rose pedals. The Gin barrel really is an incredible thing. In taste, it is progressively more lime pulp sour up front with unrripe nectarine. Juicy and refreshing. The finish though still holds a decent amount of buttery slickness either from the oak, chardonnay (?) wine barrel, or perhaps some sort of mild diacetyl. The tangy sour front with the buttery white wine finish is quite nice, though the butter wouldnt be missed. The sweet cream butter is a bit overtaken by saltwater eventually so maybe it wont bother too many others. I find the lactic back end to pile on with vanillin barrel and mild butter and some refreshing pineapple seltzer/effervescent. The sourness here is really dialed back, but "peach sour" would still be applicable to this beer. It is certainly delicious and possibly the most ambitious Upright beer to date.

Pours a thick, cloudy golden color, with a thick off-white head. Smells of a tart lemon and herb concoction, with the gin coming through. Taste is of a proper sour, with lemon peel and juniper as the primary flavors and a strong tartness following through. Smooth as silk on the tongue and slightly warm without being hot from the alcohol. All around a fantastic beer from a fantastic brewer. And the Doctor Doom bottle is just icing...

Great stuff here. Aroma was lemon and citrus, light funk, juniper, and wild flowers. Flavor is similar. I loved the light sour aspect with tons of fruit and vibrant flowery notes. Very nice. Id love to try more beers from this series.

Bottle 166 of 166 thanks to OmegaX. This brew was fantastic; so much complexity and separation among tasting notes. The smell was a musty lemonade with soft oak, spices and what I thought could have been green pepper. It tasted a tad sour and funky with spicy gin, tannin, some acidity and a clean tart finish. Seriously good stuff.
Bottle 158 of 166. Pours clear orange with small white head. Nose/taste of fresh fruit, sprite, gin, spices, herbs, citrus zest and juniper. Ever so slight acidity. Medium body.
Bottle.  Golden amber pour, white head.  Sweet fruit, juniper berries, citrusy lemon zest, herbal spice, tartness, and leather.  Very interesting beer, good!

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has sweet fruit that is slightly tart with backing spice, gin, funk and juniper. Flavor has juniper and tartness up front with a backing funk and gin barrel note.

Bottle at the other nights Upright tasting. Served in a Mikasa tulip.

Bottle 132/166

Pours a sparkling, clear yellow color with an average, fizzy white head that diminishes fairly quickly into a thin collar with some sparse lacing on the sides of the glass.

The nose brings some delicate herbs with some gin in the background. A bit of citrus there as well. The flavor has a long duration with a very light sweetness plus a small dose of tartness. Light bitterness as well. Everything seems to be coming together, yet its all fairly subtle.

The body is light with high carbonation, leaving to a dry finish. Through the finish comes some additional gin and herb character plus a light burst of citrus.

A very interesting and delicious beer that I was glad to try. Heres hoping that Upright makes this one again.

Sole Comp bottle 129 of 166. Pours a golden straw with little head. Smell is apricot, light fruit, oak and some zest. Taste is sour upfront with notes of prickly fruit and light oak. High carbonation and a dry finish. Reminded me a bit of a fruited berliner weiss. One of my favorites of the sole comps.

Hazy light amber.  Thin head.  The aroma is great, with lots of herbal character and the gin shows through a lot.  Very tart, with lots of spice.  Woody, complex, super drinkable.  Another great Upright beer.

Cloudy apricot pour, nice head.  Aroma is really damn cool! I get the juniper berries, some citrus notes, even some nice herbal notes.  Flavor is so nice, yeasty, spices, herbs, juniper, fruitiness.  Damn this was good.  Thanks Bryan!
Bottle shared by Beerlando at Hunahpuh day. Hazy orange. Wonderful aroma of spritzy juniper, genuine genever, lemon-lime. Ultra refreshing. A ton of fruit here, pear and tart apples. Loving this!
bottle thanks to kan. Pours blond wh head nose rye spicy earthy prune, florals, mints, ginger, juniper berry, fl earthy soured pruney, cherry pits, gin, moldy finish, okay not really my fl profile,

Bottle number 18/166 pour thanks to Scott for the tasting! Gin barrel aged gruit, skeptical to say the least at first.  Pour was clear reddish with white head, aroma has notes of sweet fruit with orange, lemon, grapefruit, tangerine, and some nice tart fruit in there as well mixing with the fruit of the gin.  Taste was all sweet and tart fruit, with balanced notes of orange, lemon, tart fruit and some slight herbal notes make this way too easy to drink.

750 ml bottle shared with Doodler and company poured a hazy gold with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of straw, spice, citrus and light horseblanket. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, citrus, spice and horseblanket with a crisp dry tart lingering horseblanket finish.

Bottle with Doodler and Co. Thanks everyone! Hazy, yellow-orange appearance with a smallish head. Orange citrusy, light berry, slightly tart, spicy aroma. Quite tangy citrusy, fairly (citrusy) sour, lightly funky, spicy flavor. Really a nice citrusy sour.

bottle... sounded like this was a mess waiting to happen, but a very pleasant beer overall... cloudy medium orange body, light watery head... the aroma is strong, lots of gin, acidic fruits, lots of gruit notes juniper dominant, by them selves dont really enjoy these aromas but it works here... I really like the taste, but its something while enjoying I could only have a few ounces of, again a lot of gin, fruit some peaches, more juniper, very dry... worth trying but make sure youre splitting with a lot of people

(750ml bottle #99/166 thanks to sideshowe) cloudy orange with fine white bubbles and great lacing. Nose is mildly tart, currant, wet wood, light grapefruit and tangerine. Taste of metal, cranberry, spices, currant, short duration of flavor but easy to drink.

Bottle shared by some generous folks at the Jackie Os bottle sale on 8/27/11. Clear gold pour with a thin white head. Funky aroma with lemon and herbal notes. Herbal flavor of sage and lemongrass with a sour lemon finish.

Sample at the Jackie Os Bottle Sale on 08/27/2011. The beer is a hazy tangerine color with a medium foamy off-white head that dissipates steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of funky fruits and herbs. Medium body with a moderately sour character and flavors of tart fruit, herbs and grainy malt. The finish is fruity with a spicy, herbal aftertaste. Above average overall.
Pours a peach color with a thin head. Has a sour peach smell or some kind of fruit. Has a current sour taste with some sour citrus at the end. Little thin in the back but pretty solid.

750ml bottle. Yet another thanks to Todd for passing along this badboy. Bottle 107 of 166... Pours a semi to mostly hazy orangey lemny brown hue and crowned with a thin to medium fluffy white head... Aroma contains quite a bit of juniper gin botanicals and abundant to that degree. Tart semi-sour expression behind it all. Much more gin barrel forward than expected but totally cool and non-disarming especially from a person who is not the biggest gin fan... Flavors progress to more of a tart orangey citrus nature that they usually exemplify and then express more of the gin properties with the juniper slash pine qualities of the aforementioned alcohol. Body is light and extremely palatable. Hate to be abdomen record but this was quite a nice surprise although the barrel aged seven was enjoyed just a touch bit more.

Bootle.    Aroma of christmas tree spruce juniper aroma.   Honestly,  just about a perfect gin compliment to a beer.   Cant ask for much more.  Taste is bright grassy citric rustic spruce and boasted almonds.   Complex.  Clean.  Fruity rustic dry spruce ginger beer.  A little too good.
Nose was lemon and lacto (apple, tart, etc.). Taste was sweet malts, tartness, and finished dry. Thanks Sam.

Bottle, shared by ucusty.  Thanks Dave!  tropical fruits.  pear.  honeysuckle.  some spices.  juniper.  The aroma has so much going on.  Flavor is equally intriguing with an acidic mouthfeel that works very well.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Thanks ucusty for sharing. Pours bright lemon rind yellow with one finger of white head. Nose is cidery with notes of apples skin and sprucy botanicals. Very interesting flavor with a nice acetic character and notes of pear and spice. Light bodied and effervescent with a lovely acidity. 

4/14/2014. Share by JCB.  Cloudy pale pour with a crackling thin head.  Nice nose, very ephemeral herb quality, ginger and juniper showing the most with a steady spicy notes and shandy-ish quality (as Jason called it).  Clean herbal quality in the flavor with ginger and juniper dominating.  Very refreshing and light.

Courtesy of Sam, thanks! Pours slightly hazy gold with nice bright white head. The aroma has spiciness, hay, gin, spicy yeast and some herbal like goodness. The taste has a nice mix of spices, near lemon like acidity, some hay and meadow like notes and some herbs. The acidity grows right into the finish to go along with growing gin and herbal notes. This pulls together nicely.

Thanks to Ogglethorpe for sharing what had to be the surprise beer of the day, maybe in the last couple years.  You rule Brian!!! Hazy gold pour with a fizzy white head.  Loads of complexity here on the nose and on the flavor front.  Nose shows juniper berry,  old Tom botanicals and orange juice.  I spent some time savoring the complexities I cant even begin to explain them.  Spice,  citrus, juniper, grain and oak.    If anyone has a spare botlle for me please hook me up.

Bottle (70-166) listed as Sole Composition: Special Herbs, gruit aged in old tom gin barrels. Pours with a hazed golden body with a white head. Aromas of juniper, lactic acid, herbs, spice, wood and gin. Flavors are very lactic sour, spicy, acidic, light herbs. Dry, tart and acidic.

Bottle shared by Sam number 23/166 aged in Old Tom Gin Barrels. A very odd concoction, but it really works. Pours a murky orange color with a medium white head. A fruity funky and even sour nose, some hops come through as well. The flavor is lots of things; sourness, herbal notes, hops and pine, tart fruits. No gin that I noticed. Spicy as well. Not sure what this is, but I like it and it is ingenious.

Bottle shared by Sam at the slc tasting, thanks 
Appearance: Slightly hazy yellow with a nice sized white head and light lacing 
Aroma: Tart fruits, herbal and spices 
Taste: Tart fruits and sour malts 
Nice and easy to drink

Bottle.   Pours a bright golden color with a thin white champagne like head.   Aroma is bright, citrusy, herbal, gin notes, grassy even.   Flavor is again bright, herbal, some citrus, some freshly cut grass, lemon, and juniper.   Palate is on the light side, with a refreshing champange like carbonation, finished lightly tart and slightly acidic.   Fantast stuff, probably my favorite and most surprising beer Ive had in years!   Fantastic use of a new barrel type, the botanicals from the gruit pair nicely with the botanicals of the gin.   I could drink this all day, every day!

Tap. Hazy pour, immediately struck by the acidic funky nose. Flavor was stone fruits, most of the herbs were gone, big sourness with some spruce? a little alcohol heat. I really liked this, I am glad they bottled some for their Sole Composition series.
